mosais.distribution

Class PlotTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • mosais.distribution.PlotTree
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BestCandidatePlot, PoissonPlot, RandomPlot

    public abstract class PlotTree
extends java.lang.Object
    A quadtree backed distribution of points in a two dimensional plane.
    Author:
    Andrew Trismen

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlotTree

        public PlotTree(int numPoints,
        int width,
        int height)
        Construct a new distribution tree with the given number of points and dimensions.
        Parameters:
        numPoints - Number of points to generate for the plot.
        width - Width of the area in which to place points.
        height - Height of the area in which to place points.

    • Method Detail

      • createDistribution

        public abstract void createDistribution()
        Generate the distribution of points.

      • getNumPoints

        public int getNumPoints()
        Get number of points that should be included in the plot.
        Returns:
        Number of points that will be in the plot.

      • getPlotWidth

        public int getPlotWidth()
        Returns:
        Width of the distribution area.

      • getPlotHeight

        public int getPlotHeight()
        Returns:
        Height of the distribution area.

      • getDistributionAsList

        public java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getDistributionAsList()
        Get all of the points currently in this distribution as a List.
        Returns:
        List object containing all points in the distribution.

      • insert

        public void insert(java.awt.Point p)
        Insert a point into the quadtree. The point will be inserted into the appropriate node of the tree automatically. A copy of the reference will also be stored in a list for getting later.
        Parameters:
        p - Point to insert into the tree.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if p has a location outside the bounds of the tree.

      • getClosestNeighbor

        public java.awt.Point getClosestNeighbor(java.awt.Point p,
                                BoundingBox initialSearchZone)
        Find the closest neighbor currently in the quadtree to the given point.
        Parameters:
        p - Point to find the closest current neighbor of.
        Returns:
        Point that is closest to the given point p.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If p lies outside the bounds of the tree

      • searchTree

        private java.awt.Point searchTree(java.awt.Point target,
                        java.awt.Point closest,
                        Quadtree<java.awt.Point> searchNode,
                        BoundingBox searchZone)
        Search the tree for a closest neighbor recursively.
        Parameters:
        target - Point to find closest neighbor of
        closest - Point that is the closest found to target
        searchNode - The node of the tree being searched at this stage of the search
        searchZone - The current area around target being searched.
        Returns:
        The closest point found to target.

      • resizeSearchZone

        private void resizeSearchZone(java.awt.Point target,
                    java.awt.Point closest,
                    BoundingBox searchZone)
        Change the dimensions of the search zone
        Parameters:
        target - Point the search box is centered on.
        closest - Closest point found to the target.

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
        To run after completing a run of processing. Nulls references to the data structures to save space and prepare for another run.
